intro: Hutchinsia brevicaulis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hutchinsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
